abstracts.cdata!:
The consolidation of the protected areas
            system project for Mexico will promote the conservation and
            sustainable use of biodiversity in Mexico through the
            consolidation of the National System Protected Areas (SNAP)
            by: conserving globally important biodiversity in selected
            areas of SNAP through an endowment fund; promoting the
            economic, social and environmental sustainability of
            productive activities in selected protected areas; promoting
            social co-responsibility for conservation; and in general,
            promoting the inclusion of biodiversity conservation and
            sustainable criteria in development projects and other
            practices affecting selected protected areas. This project
            extends the protected areas program initiated with GEF
            funding in 1992 and restructured as an endowment funds to
            support conservation of 10 protected areas in 1997 (Project
            SINAP l),by adding 12 new protected areas to the program.
